alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 9:07PM CDT until July 10 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Blaine, Caddo, Custer and Canadian Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Middle and upper bottomlands may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. The river stage at 7:00 PM is estimated at 14.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Monday morning at 915 AM CDT.
